result.execSummary:
The defendant Razelle T Creed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Involve Injury, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**AMENDED 3-16-2015:  HUBER FOR EMPLOYMENT.**

AMENDED 04/01/2015 - HUBER IS GRANTED FOR PARENTING COURSES, AODA ASSESSMENT, AND FOLLOW-UP COUNSELING AS WELL AS INDIVIDUAL THERAPY PURSUANT TO THE DISPOSITIONAL ORDER IN THE JC CASES AS MONITORED AND IMPLEMENTED BY RACINE COUNTY HUMAN SERVICES AGENT. THE JAIL SHALL VERIFY ALL COURSES AND RELEASE.

Defendant Razelle T Creed in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Razelle T Creed in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 08-31-2015/tk
Defense requests modification of jail terms. Defense is asking that defendant be allowed to participate in AODA program in custody, which commences on June 1. The State agrees AODA counseling is appropriate but the State believes the out of custody portion of the AODA program would be contrary to the intent of the Court due to the punishment received by the victim. The State has no problem with huber to include AODA therapy and counseling but does not feel the AODA program is appropriate at this time.

BTC: Defendant has not yet served enough time to avail himself to the AODA program. The Court will allow that after a period of 12 months, the defendant may engage in the AODA jail program. The defendant may have Huber to obtain his GED. Defense to prepare an order regarding the Court's decision today.
